content:
• Monday, August 8, 2016
  • CC

    Chemours beats by $0.10, misses on revenue

    • Chemours (NYSE:CC): Q2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $1.38B (-8.6% Y/Y) misses by $40M.
    • Shares +2.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 PM | 12 Comments
  • FLNT

    IDI +4.1% as it narrows losses again

    • IDI (IDI) gained 4.1% after hours following Q2 results where it trimmed losses again and its adjusted EBITDA and cash flow from operations both moved into positive ground.
    • Net loss shrank to $7.2M from a year-ago $45.5M. EBITDA rose to $3.1M (beating an expected $2.1M) from a year-ago loss of $1.3M.
    • Revenue by segment: Information Services, $13.4M; Performance Marketing, $27.6M
    • On average the company says it's generating more than 700,000 consumer registrations per day in its Information Services Segment. In Performance Marketing, it expects to roll out several new media brands in the second half.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 PM
  • ELNK

    EarthLink -4.5% as Q2 revenues miss expectations

    • EarthLink (NASDAQ:ELNK) is 4.5% lower in postmarket trading after Q2 earnings where profits beat expectations, but revenues dipped 15% and missed.
    • The company swung to a profit of $4.1M after last year's Q2 featured a loss of $9.9M. EBITDA of $56.6M fell 14.4% but edged expectations for $56.4M. Gross margin was $129.4M, vs. a year-ago $156.6M.
    • Revenues were affected by some discontinued offerings; excluding those, they fell 11% Y/Y and 3% sequentially.
    • Revenue breakout: Enterprise/Mid-Market, $97.6M (down 14.7%); Small Business, $57.3M (down 27.5%); Carrier/Transport, $35.1M (up 2.9%); Consumer, $50.4M (down 10.2%).
    • Net cash from operations was $40.3M, and unlevered free cash flow came to $39.9M vs. last year's $45.2M.
    • Conference call to come tomorrow at 8:30 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD to launch 38.85M-share bought deal offering

    • IAMGOLD (NYSE:IAG) -6.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 38.85M common shares on a bought deal basis at US$5.15 each for ~$200M in total gross proceeds, plus an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 5.827M shares.
    • IAG says it plans to use to ~$150M of the proceeds to fund a tender offer for its outstanding 6.75% senior notes, with the remainder to fund internal growth projects, including the expansion of the Sadiola mine.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM | 16 Comments
  • REN

    Resolute Energy +19% AH post-earnings after surging 23% in regular trade

    • Resolute Energy (NYSE:REN), which already had surged 23.7% in regular trading to a new 52-week high, is +19.7% AH despite reporting a huge Q2 loss on 27% lower revenues Y/Y.
    • REN says production from its Permian Basin properties rose 1% Y/Y to 5,614  boe/day and jumped 90% from 2,961 boe/day produced during Q1.
    • REN also raised its production guidance by 13%, and enjoyed a record low lease operating expense in the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • TUBE

    TubeMogul tumbles 22% as ad spending falls

    • TubeMogul (TUBE +6.5%) has given up gains and then some after hours, down 22.2%, after it missed on top and bottom lines in Q2 earnings and cut full-year guidance.
    • Revenue grew more than 21% but total spend (gross dollar volume through platform) disappointed. Mobile spend grew 146% and now is nearly 30% of spend.
    • "Given Q2 results" and expected seasonality, along with an acceleration to mobile from desktop, the company cut full-year guidance
    • Revenue breakout: Platform Direct, $23.4M (up 31.1%); Platform Services, $32.1M (up 16.1%).
    • For Q3, the company's guiding toward GAAP revenue of $53M-$55M, total spend of $134M-$136M, gross profit of $35M-$37M, and EBITDA of -$5M to -$3M (below consensus for $1.3M).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • DRYS

    DryShips -30% AH after big Q2 loss, inability to pay lenders

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) -30.9% AH after reporting a large Q2 loss on an 83% Y/Y decline in revenue; Q2 adjusted EBITDA was negative $10.1M.
    • DRYS says it is in discussions with its lenders for the restructuring of its debt facilities, as six of its bank facilities have matured and it has not made the final balloon installment; for the remaining bank facilities, DRYS is suspending principal and interest payments to preserve cash liquidity.
    • DRYS also says Executive VP Anthony Kandylidis has assumed the duties of CFO as of today.
    • DRYS said Friday that it will undergo a 1-for-4 reverse split effective Aug. 15 after receiving notice from Nasdaq that it failed to maintain the $1 minimum bid price requirement for continued listing.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 PM | 8 Comments
  • PEGI

    Pattern Energy to launch 10M-share bought deal offering

    • Pattern Energy (NASDAQ:PEGI) -3.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 10M common shares on a bought deal basis at US$23.90 each for ~$239M in total gross proceeds, plus an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.5M shares.
    • PEGI says it plans to use the proceeds to fund potential acquisition opportunities, repayment of its revolving credit facility and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 32 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: HIIQ +22.2%. REN +13.8%. CSLT +8.8%. NVRO +6.2%. VSLR +5.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TUBE -24.1%. MXL -14.6%. MTW -12.8%. NPTN -11.0%. ROG -10.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • HEAR

    Turtle Beach beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Turtle Beach (NASDAQ:HEAR): Q2 EPS of -$0.23 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $29.4M (+30.0% Y/Y) beats by $4.46M.
    • Shares +11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 11 Comments
  • PSXP

    Phillips 66 Partners to launch 6M-unit offering

    • Phillips 66 Partners (NYSE:PSXP) -1.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 6M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 900K units.
    • PSXP says it plans to use the proceeds to fund its purchase of additional equity interests in Explorer Pipeline and its contribution to the recently formed STACK Pipeline joint venture with Plains All American Pipeline; any remaining proceeds would be used for general partnership purposes, including the  funding of future acquisitions and organic projects and paying down debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • REN

    Resolute Energy EPS of -$2.44

    • Resolute Energy (NYSE:REN): Q2 EPS of -$2.44 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.03.
    • Revenue of $55.9M (-15.8% Y/Y) beats by $4.34M.
    • Shares +7.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • BWXT

    BWX Technologies beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • BWX Technologies (NYSE:BWXT): Q2 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $402.38M (+12.7% Y/Y) beats by $35.34M.
    • Shares +1.55%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo beats by $0.12, beats on revenue

    • Endo (NASDAQ:ENDP): Q2 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $921M (+25.3% Y/Y) beats by $56.66M.
    • Shares +12.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 16 Comments
  • LC

    LendingClub -4% as loss widens, CFO joins exodus

    • LendingClub (NYSE:LC) is off 4% following Q2 results with a bigger-than-expected loss and another executive shuffle.
    • Chief Financial Officer Carrie Dolan is leaving for a new opportunity. CEO Renaud Laplanche departed the company along with three other senior managers in May amid scandal.
    • The company's controller, Bradley Coleman, will serve as interim CFO.
    • Net loss widened to $81.4M from a year-ago loss of $4.1M, though revenues of $102.4M came in ahead of consensus. The company says re-engaging investors is working, "with fifteen of our top twenty largest investors back on the platform today," says CEO Scott Sanborn, who replaced Laplanche at the helm.
    • Loan originations were up to $1.96B form the prior $1.91B. Cash, equivalents and securities available for sale came to $832M against no outstanding debt.
    • For Q3, LendingClub is guiding to operating revenues of $95M-$105M and EBITDA of -$30M to -$15M (well below consensus for $7.4M).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 8 Comments
  • WB

    Weibo beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Weibo (NASDAQ:WB): Q2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $146.9M (+36.2% Y/Y) beats by $5.75M.
    • Shares +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • CFMS

    ConforMIS beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • ConforMIS (NASDAQ:CFMS): Q2 EPS of -$0.34 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $19.3M (+0.4% Y/Y) beats by $1.28M.
    • Shares +5.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • SINA

    Sina beats by $0.12, beats on revenue

    • Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $241.35M (+14.4% Y/Y) beats by $9.66M.
    • Shares +2.75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • BLCM

    Bellicum Pharmaceuticals misses by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Bellicum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BLCM): Q2 EPS of -$0.61 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $0.1M (+25.0% Y/Y) beats by $0.01M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • GPS

    Gap lower after July sales disappoint, EPS guidance light

    • Gap (NYSE:GPS) reports comparable sales fell 4% in July, driven lower by a 14% drop for the Banana Republic Global brand.
    • Old Navy generated a flat comp for the month.
    • Total July sales were $1.12B. The company ended Q2 with revenue of $3.85B racked up.
    • The company expects to report Q2 EPS of $0.58 to $0.58 vs. $0.48 consensus.
    • GPS -3.40% AH to $24.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • BOJA

    Bojangles lower after reporting sluggish comp

    • Bojangles (NASDAQ:BOJA) reports system-wide comparable restaurant sales increased 0.2% in Q2. Comparable store transactions were up 0.5% during the quarter.
    • Restaurant contribution margin increased 60 bps to 19.7%.
    • Looking ahead, Bojangles sees 2016 revenue of $$530M-$533M vs. a prior view of 533M-$543M and EPS of $0.99-$0.92. 60 to 65 restaurant openings are anticipated.
    • BOJA -4.50% AH to $17.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • HIIQ

    Health Insurance Innovations beats by $0.21, beats on revenue

    • Health Insurance Innovations (NASDAQ:HIIQ): Q2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.21.
    • Revenue of $44.5M (+95.6% Y/Y) beats by $7.39M.
    • Shares +7.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • X

    U.S. Steel to launch 17M-share offering

    • U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) -2.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 17M common shares - ~11.5% of total current shares outstanding - with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 2.55M shares.
    • U.S. Steel says it plans to use the proceeds for financial flexibility, capital expenditures and other general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 19 Comments
  • TWLO

    Twilio beats by $0.07

    • Twilio (NYSE:TWLO): Q2 EPS of -$0.08 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $64.5M (+70.0% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.65%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • BXE

    Bellatrix Exploration gets NYSE continued listing standards notice

    • Bellatrix Exploration (BXE +1.9%) is higher despite receiving a continued listing standards notice from the NYSE after Friday's close because its average closing price was less than US$1/share for 30 consecutive trading days.
    • BXE has six months to regain compliance with the minimum share price requirement.
    • BXE shares continue to trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange, and the listing is not affected by the NYSE notification.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 11 Comments
  • WY

    Weyerhaeuser downgraded to Neutral at DA Davidson

    • Weyerhauser (WY -1.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $33 price target at DA Davidson following the company's Q2 earnings and revenue miss.
    • The firm cuts its FY 2016 EPS estimate by $0.09 to $0.53 due to a higher than anticipated full-year share count and the elimination of the residual contribution from the paper segment that offsets a higher contribution from wood.
    • Davidson also sees potential risk for building products in the future, as a prolonged recession or a double dip in the housing market could lower pricing and demand for many of WY's building products, which could adversely affect revenues and operating results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • PBR

    Brazil antitrust regulator recommends penalty for Petrobras

    • Brazil's antitrust regulator Cade recommends penalizing Petrobras (PBR +3.4%) for anti-competitive behavior in the natural gas distribution market following an investigated that showed the state-run company began "discriminatory" behavior in 2011, when it introduced a discount on the prices of natural gas transported on its network.
    • According to Cade, PBR gave price discounts to its own distributor that operated adjacent to a rival distributor in the natural gas market of Sao Paulo, Brazil's largest.
    • The case will now be tried before Cade's tribunal at a date yet to be determined.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 6 Comments
  • SFM

    Analysts weigh in on Sprouts Farmers Market

    • Northcoast Research downgrades Sprouts Farmers Market (SFM -2.3%) to a Neutral rating after having the grocery stock set at Buy.
    • Sprouts also saw its price target cut by Citigroup (to $28 from $33) and Piper Jaffray (to $21 from $28).
    • BMO Capital backed an Outperform rating on SFM, while Credit Suisse is sticking with a Buy stance.
    • Sprouts Farmers Market issued its Q2 report last week.
    • Previously: Sprouts Farmers Market beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Aug. 4)
    • Previously: Solid traffic gain for Sprouts Farmers Market in Q2 (Aug. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 1 Comment

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: ISNS +62%. MIFI +12%. PTI +11%. RESN +10%. LIVE +10%.
    • Losers: CRNT -17%. HMNY -12%. MTSL -8%. DGLY -8%. COVS -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • JOUT

    Johnson Outdoors falls after sales disappoint

    • Johnson Outdoors (JOUT -8.2%) is sharply lower after suffering from a lower level of tent sales to large outdoor retailers in FQ3.
    • Diving revenue was also weak, down 4.8% Y/Y due to softer demand from the Middle East.
    • The company's operating profit fell 17% to $13.6M during the quarter.
    • Shares of Johnson Outdoors are still up 23% over the last 90 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • CRC

    California Resources upsizes offers to purchase notes for cash

    • California Resources (CRC +28.7%) is soaring after increasing the funds available for its buyback offer for four series of its senior debt to $750M from $525M.
    • The 43% increase will raise CRC's previously announced tender offer for its 5% senior notes due 2020, 5.5% senior notes due 2021, 6% senior notes due 2024 and its 8% second lien secured notes due 2022.
    • CRC also says it is increasing the amount of 8% second-lien notes it will accept for repurchase to $375M from $200M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: PACD +30%. CRC +30%. SN +23%. EMES +21%. MPET +20%.
    • Losers: SAEX -48%. THM -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMCSA

    'Suicide Squad' sets August record with $135M opening

    • (Anti)-Hero film Suicide Squad (TWX -0.4%) led the box office as expected, setting an August opening record with $135M, but facing what could be a steep drop after a critical savaging.
    • The film broke 2014's August record of $94.3M set by Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy by logging $135.1M in grosses, and bested second-week films Jason Bourne (CMCSA -0.4%, No. 2 with $22.7M) and Bad Moms (STX, No. 3 with $14.2M).
    • The top five was rounded out by The Secret Life of Pets (NASDAQ:CMCSA), with $11.6M in its fifth week ($319.6M cumulative) and Star Trek Beyond (VIA -2.5%, VIAB -2.2%), with $10.2M in its third week ($127.9M cumulative).
    • Suicide Squad has just a 25% fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes and a mixed 40 rating on Metacritic, but a B+ CinemaScore.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • KHC

    Four food stocks tapped for outperformance

    • Susquehanna gives a brief update to investors on its four top food sector picks (all rated at Positive). Analyst Pablo Zuanic prefers companies with a North American focus.
    • Kraft Heinz (KHC -0.7%): 3G is expected to have more tricks up its sleeve to improve the bottom line. "We see more accretive deal making," writes Zuanic.
    • TreeHouse Foods (THS -1.5%): TreeHouse is seen benefiting from the integration of the ConAgra private label businesses and improving K-cup trends.
    • Molson Coors (TAP -0.2%): EBIT margin has room to move higher after the inefficiencies of the JV structure with MillerCoors are behind it.
    • Mondelez International (MDLZ +0.3%): Zuanic expects M&A action at MDLZ.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • BCS

    Barclays to pay $100M to resolve states’ LIBOR manipulation claims

    • Barclays (BCS +2.7%) agrees to a $100M settlement to end investigations by 43 states and D.C. into its alleged manipulation of LIBOR rates in the mid-2000s.
    • The settlement comes four years after BCS resolved similar charges with U.S. and U.K. authorities; the state attorneys general, led by New York and Connecticut, launched their own probes in 2012 in the wake of those charges.
    • BCS is the first of several global banks to resolve LIBOR manipulation allegations from state attorneys general that already have paid billions of dollars in penalties to resolve similar criminal and civil charges.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers /Losers

    • Gainers: MFRM +114%. ISNS +105%. PRAN +30%. HTBX +29%. CRC +28%. MPET +23%. MEIP +23%. SN +22%. EMES +20%. PACD +19%.
    • Losers: SAEX -45%. LKFN -33%. CHEK -25%. REFR -15%. CRNT -13%. LILAK -12%. EPZM -12%. HMNY -11%. LILA -11%. LNTH -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • GNL

    Global Net Lease to buy American Realty Capital Global Trust II for $247M

    • Global Net Lease (GNL -2.1%) agrees to acquire American Realty Capital Global Trust II for $247M in stock; the REIT also reports Q2 results, which included a 9.5% Y/Y increase in rental income.
    • GNL - which owns properties in the U.S., U.K. and Puerto Rico - says buying Global II will reduce its top-10 concentration by 35% and help to balance its European and U.S. portfolio.
    • When the deal closes, expected in Q4, Global II shareholders will own ~14% of the combined company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: BDE +11%. KOSS +7%. GPRO +7%.
    • Losers: HY -10%. FORD -8%. JOUT -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • SM

    SM Energy deal continues strong valuations for Permian properties

    • SM Energy’s (SM +7.2%) $980M purchase of drilling rights in the Permian Basin shows that producers are willing to pay a premium for access to one of the few spots where oil exploration still turns a profit, Bloomberg reports.
    • SM will pay the equivalent of $39.5K/acre for drilling rights across 24,783 acres in the Permian Basin, will ahead of the $25K-$35K that acreage in the Permian’s Midland Basin section had been fetching as recently as May and almost doubling SM's holdings in the region.
    • Other Permian producers also are trading higher, including: PXD +2.2%, CXO +1.8%, XEC +2.1%, CWEI +6.1%, APA +3.8%, FANG +2.1%, PE +1.2%, QEP +3.6%, RSPP +2.4%, APC +2.6%, DVN +3.7%, MTDR +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • TPX

    Tempur Sealy higher after Mattress Firm buyout

    • Shares of Tempur Sealy (NYSE:TPX) are up 1.2% on significant volume after Mattress Firm attracts a hefty takeover offer.
    • The bedding stocks trades on the higher end of its 52-week range of $50.80 and $82.61, despite the elevated amount of interest from short sellers.
    • Previously: New 52-week high for Select Comfort (Aug. 8)
    • Previously: Steinhoff gets in bed with Mattress Firm (Aug. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM

  • Energy stocks, crude oil rising on renewed hope for OPEC freeze deal

    • Energy stocks (XLE +1.8%) are off to a strong start as oil prices hit a nearly two-week high on hopes of a production freeze by the world’s largest oil exporters; U.S. crude oil recently was +2.5% at $42.87/bbl.
    • Qatar’s Energy Minister says OPEC will hold on an informal meeting in Algeria during Sept. 26-28, following reports that several OPEC members want to revive the idea of limits on oil production; a similar initiative died in April when Saudi Arabia backed out over Iran’s refusal to join in a production freeze.
    • Some analysts also cite an improvement in the gasoline crack margin as providing a tailwind for the market, yet many analysts and traders say today's gains likely will be short-lived due to the glut of crude and refined products looming over the market, as well as skepticism over substantial OPEC action.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, XLE, UWTI, UCO, VDE, ERX, DWTI, OIH, SCO, XOP, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, DTO, USL, DUG, BGR, XES, IYE, IEO, FENY, IEZ, DNO, PXE, FIF, OLO, PXJ, RYE, SZO, NDP, GUSH, DRIP, FXN, DDG, OLEM, CRAK
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 45 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz and Avis Budget extend mini-rally into new week

    • Hertz Global (HTZ +2.1%) and Avis Budget Group (CAR +1%) both trek higher to extend on some gains put in late last week amid a broad travel sector rally.
    • The vote of confidence from investors comes ahead of Hertz's Q2 earnings report which is due out after the bell tonight. Analysts expect Hertz to report revenue of $2.637B and EPS of $0.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 2 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: MEIP +33%. HTBX +28%. PRAN +20%. OTC:ECTE +11%. PFNX +9%.
    • Losers: CHEK -24%. ATRA -11%. ADAP -11%. LNTH -10%. EPZM -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • BMY

    Bristol-Myers Squibb continues lower; Credit Suisse downgrades

    • Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -3.2%) extends Friday's whopping losses following the unexpected failure of its Opdivo lung cancer drug in a late-stage clinical trial.
    • Credit Suisse downgrades BMY to Neutral with a $63 price target, slashed from $86, after maintaining an Outperform rating since at least October 2013; the firm says it had high expectations for the study not just meeting its primary endpoint but potentially other important secondary endpoints.
    • Credit Suisse says the results dramatically impact the way it sees the immuno-oncology market evolving in the near-term, as it also upgrades rival Merck (MRK -2.7%) to Outperform from Neutral with a $73 price target, upped from $62.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 19 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean rig runs aground off Scotland

    • A Transocean (RIG +2.5%) drilling rig has run aground off the west coast of Scotland after breaking free from a tug boat amid strong winds.
    • The semi-submersible rig was being transported from Norway to Malta when the tow line broke and it was pushed aground off the Isle of Lewis; the company says no personnel are on board and there is no risk to life.
    • The Transocean Winner rig reportedly was set to be scrapped after its $498K/day contract with Det Norske Oljeselskap expired last month, which would make it the first Norway-compliant floater to head for the scrapyard.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 8 Comments
  • SNBR

    New 52-week high for Select Comfort

    • Shares of Select Comfort (SCSS +5.7%) are higher following the acquisition of peer Mattress Firm for a very healthy premium.
    • Select Comfort carved out a new 52-week high of $27.22 before settling back a bit.
    • Previously: Steinhoff gets in bed with Mattress Firm (Aug. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • NFEC

    NF Energy Saving +13% following contract news

    • NF Energy Saving (NFEC +12.7%) surges in early trading after announcing that it signed export sales contracts with five companies in four countries to supply its flow control devices.
    • NFEC says the contracts signify that its flow control products and services are competitive in the global market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • FRED

    Fred's lower after Deutsche Bank warns on back-half pressure

    • Shares of Fred's (FRED -7.3%) slump after Deutsche Bank shifts to a Sell rating and lowers its price target to $12.
    • DB thinks the retailer will continue to see headwinds in the second half of the year as competition in the discounter sector ramps up.
    • "We see potential for further downward guidance revisions, in the same vein as in 2H last year, and are modeling modestly below consensus for this year and next year," writes analyst Paul Trussell.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • DAL

    Delta Air Lines resumes limited service

    • Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) lifted its grounds stop on all flights to resume some limited service.
    • A cascading wave of cancellations and delays is still expected over the next two days.
    • DAL -1.25% premarket to $37.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • MEIP

    MEI Pharma +48% on leukemia drug deal

    • MEI Pharma (NASDAQ:MEIP) resumes trading after a halt, +48.4% premarket after announcing a licensing, development and commercialization agreement with Swiss pharmaceutical group Helsinn.
    • Helsinn will gain exclusive worldwide rights, including manufacturing and commercialization rights, and will be responsible for funding the global development of Pracinostat, MEIP's Phase 3-ready drug candidate for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia.
    • MEIP will receive near-term payments of $20M, and may receive up to $444M in potential development, regulatory and sales-based milestone payments, along with additional tiered royalty payments in selected territories.

  • WMT

    Wal-Mart confirms Jet.com acquisition

    • Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) formally announces it acquired Jet.com for approximately $3B in cash. Part of the payment will be paid over time. Additionally, $300M of Walmart shares will be paid as part of the transaction.
    • Both boards have approved the deal.
    • The company says the acquisition will build on and complement the significant foundation already in place to serve customers across the Walmart app, site and stores and position the company for even faster e-commerce growth in the future by expanding customer reach and adding new capabilities.
    • “We’re looking for ways to lower prices, broaden our assortment and offer the simplest, easiest shopping experience because that’s what our customers want,” says Wal-Mart CEO Doug McMillon.
    • News of a potential deal leaked last week.
    • Shares of WMT are up 0.43% premarket to $74.08.

  • SM

    SM Energy to acquire Midland Basin acreage for $980M

    • SM Energy (NYSE:SM) -3.1% premarket after agreeing to acquire nearly 25K net acres in Howard County, Tex., from Rock Oil Holdings for $980M.
    • The deal expands SM’s Midland Basin footprint to 46,750 net acres and includes ~4,900 boe/day net production, with two new wells coming online this month, and 6M boe of proved developed producing reserves.
    • To fund the deal, SM plans a public offering of 15M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to another 2.25M shares, and an offering of $100M of senior convertible notes due 2021.
    • SM also says it expects to run one rig in the Permian Basin in Q4 and two rigs throughout 2017, prompting it to raise its estimate of 2016 total capital spending by $15M-$20M.
